name: Tim Wendelboe Aeropress recipe
short_description: A recipe by Tim Wendelboe, World Barista Champion and World Cup Tasters Champion. [Watch the tutorial here](https://timwendelboe.no/brew-guides/aeropress/).

steps.description: Rinse the paper filter with running tap water for a few seconds and pour in coffee grounds
Pour <final_water_amount>g of water over the coffee.
Stir 3 times.
Place the plunger on the Aeropress in order to prevent the water from draining through the filter and let the coffee steep.
Take the plunger off and  stir 3 times back to front.
Place the plunger on top of the Aeropress and press the contents into a large cup or pitcher by using your body weight.

name: James Hoffmann Aeropress recipe
short_description: A recipe by James Hoffmann, winner of World barista Championship, YouTuber, coffee consultant, and author. For medium roast coffee, using 90-95°C water will give you better results. For dark roast coffee, try 85-90°C water for the brew. Grind your coffee at the finer end of medium, assuming this is light roasted coffee. The darker you go the more you may prefer to increase the dose and coarsen the grind. [Watch the tutorial here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j6VlT_jUVPc).

steps.description: Set brewer in standard position on a server. Don't rinse or preheat the brewer (it doesn't make any difference). Pour in coffee grounds
Pour <final_water_amount>g of water aiming to wet all the coffee during pouring.
Place the plunger on top of the brewer, about 1cm in.
Wait 2 minutes.
Holding the brewer and the plunger, gently swirl the brewer.
Wait 30 seconds.
Press gently all the way.

name: Alan Adler Aeropress recipe
short_description: A recipe by Alan Adler, the inventor of Aeropress. This recipe produces a concentrate or 'espresso' style coffee. Simply add hot water to your tasting to make more of an 'Americano' style coffee. [Watch the tutorial here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9c14DxfVOY4).

steps.description: Add ground coffee to the brew chamber. Give chamber a shake to level the bed of coffee.
Pour <final_water_amount>g of water to the chamber.
Stir using the paddle.
Insert plunger and press gently.

name: Wendelien van Bunnik Aeropress recipe
short_description: A recipe by Wendelien van Bunnik, a Dutch barista and the 2019 World AeroPress Champion. Note that this is an inverted method. If you're not sure how it works, [watch the tutorial first](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jLNIGf-lf3s).

steps.description: Place two paper filters in the cap and rinse with hot water. Push any air bubbles out using the paddle. Discard the rinse water. Add ground coffee to the brew chamber. Give it a shake to even out the grounds.
Pour <final_water_amount>g of over the grounds.
Stir gently 5 times.
Fasten the filter cap and let sit.
Flip the AeroPress and press into a cup. Stop when you hear a hissing sound.

name: Alexander Mills Iced Aeropress recipe
short_description: A recipe by Alexander Mills, a consultant in the coffee industry from Canada. Note that this is an inverted method. Here's [the tutorial ](https://alexandermills.ca/blog/iced-aeropress).

steps.description: Pre-rinse two paper filters in the cap to wash the papery taste out of them and preheat the brewer. Discard water and set cap aside. Fill your server with ice in amount equal to water amount. Pour in coffee grounds to Aeropress.
With the Aeropress inverted, pour (0.3 x <final_water_amount>)g of boiled water.
Stir thoroughly.
Let the coffee bloom.
Pour the remaining (0.7 x <final_water_amount>)g. of water rather quickly in concentric circles.
Give the slurry one deep stir and then cap your AeroPress.
Flip your AeroPress on top of your server and press steadily for 30s over ice. Stop your press when the AeroPress hisses.
Give your iced coffee a good swirl in your server to exchange those final molecules of heat for some cooler ones and then serve in a chilled glass.

name: Mark Prince Aeropress recipe
short_description: A recipe by Mark Prince, Canadian, USA, and World Barista Championship Judge and founder of CoffeeGeek. Here's [the detailed and interesting tutorial](https://www.coffeegeek.com/guides/aeropress-inverted-brew-method-how-to/). Note that this is an inverted method and Mike strongly advises to use metal filter instead of paper one.

steps.description: Arrange all your equipment and coffee together. Boil the water. Assemble the AeroPress. Take the plunger and insert it into the AeroPress piston just shy of 1cm into the piston, making sure it is perfectly lined up. Measure and grind your coffee. Place Aeropress on scale, pour in grounds and zero out.
Pour (0.45 x <final_water_amount>)g of boiled water into the inverted plunger.
Allow a slight bloom to form.
Give a few stirs to the slurry.
Continue pouring hot water until you reach <final_water_amount>g. of water.
Do two more stirs of the slurry, being careful not to overflow the top.
Add another 40-50g of water if possible, filling the brew chamber to as close to the rim as you can.
Attach the filter and filter holder to the AeroPress.
Place mug or server on top of the inverted AeroPress.
Flip the AeroPress and server.
Plunge down on the AeroPress, to extract the brewed coffee.

name: James Hoffmann's Iced AeroPress
short_description: Iced aeropress recipe by James Hoffmann is essentially a scaled-up version of his ultimate technique with ice as bypass. [Watch the tutorial here](https://youtu.be/DlaEwef6MTg).

steps.description: Put (0.4 x <final_water_amount>)g. of ice in the server. Set brewer in standard position on a server. Don't rinse or preheat the brewer (it doesn't make any difference). Pour in coffee grounds.
Pour (0.6 x <final_water_amount>)g. of water aiming to wet all the coffee during pouring.
Place the plunger on top of the brewer, about 1cm in.
Wait 4 minutes.
Holding the brewer and the plunger, gently swirl the brewer.
Wait 30 seconds.
Press gently all the way.
Swirl to melt all ice. Serve over fresh ice cubes.

name: AeroPress recipe by Coffee with April
short_description: The recipe yields a light and juicy coffee with low bitterness and good acidity. [Watch the tutorial here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PUsHI7jdX1k).

steps.description: Put the paper filter in, rinse it and put AeroPress on the server in standard position. Pour the coffee in.
Pour (0.25 x <final_water_amount>)g. of water in quickly, stir it a little and put the piston on to avoid dripping.
Wait.
Remove the piston, pour the remaining (0.75 x <final_water_amount>)g.of water in. Put the piston back on.
Wait.
Press down slowly, stop at the hiss.
